channel.title: Installing ubuntu
channel.description: Well i want to install ubuntu on a external hard drive i have (250Gb) because my computer only has 4Gb left. is there any way i can get ubuntu to boot from a external hardrive and save everything there too?

item.title: Installing ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

If you don’t know how to get to BIOS, then you shouldn’t bother with linux. I imagine after you actually get ubuntu installed you’ll get disheartened when your internet doesn’t work, or you can’t figure out the package manager. But don’t let me discourage you, try it out, who knows you might like it.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:6, topic:296041”][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=392069.msg2920667#msg2920667 date=1250726822]
Then Check?
[/quote]

but how >.> lol.[/quote]

Goto your BIOS, you need to get into your boot priorities. Make sure CD and/or floppy are the first two, then after that you can change it to whatever you like. If you want to boot from your external, then make sure it is before your hard drive. I think its called boot sequence or something. Just get into your BIOS and experiment!

Read full topic

item.title: Installing ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Google your bios name and version? Or better yet go into the bios setup and look for options related to USB.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

lesterknome:

Well i want to install ubuntu on a external hard drive i have (250Gb) because my computer only has 4Gb left. is there any way i can get ubuntu to boot from a external hardrive and save everything there too?

If your BIOS supports booting from USB devices, yes.

Read full topic
